122.author: Richard Case & Stan Woch, artists ; Grant Morrison, writer ; Daniel Vozzo, colorist ; John Workman, letterer ; Tom Peyer, editor
notes: Data from Gene Reed & John Bullough, via Grand Comic-Book Database.

123.heading: Wells.
123.title: "Dream of Future Veils Present Menace!"
123.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Guarding his oil well, Sid Temple daydreams of tropical leisure while a menacing figure approaches from behind.

124.heading: Wells.
124.title: "The Fantastic Wishing Well"
124.author: Mort Meskin & George Roussos, art
124.appears_in: 6 p. in House of Secrets, no. 14 (Nov. 1958) ; reprinted in House of Mystery, no. 195 (Oct. 1971).
notes: Data from Michael Tiefenbacher.

125.heading: Wells.
125.title: "The Farmer in the Well!"
125.author: [No author]
125.series: Are You a Detective?) 1 p. in Private Eye, no. 3
notes: "Starring Detective Skip McCoy."
Brief mystery with solution upside down at end.

126.heading: Wells.
126.title: "The Guardian of the Well"
126.author: art: Robert Webb
notes: Data from Gene Reed via Grand Comic Book Database.

127.heading: Wells.
127.title: "Nite Story"
127.author: John Burnham
127.appears_in: 1 p. in Shall We Do It Agin? Comix (Emeryville, Ga. : Salmon Studios, 1978).
notes: Summary: A grammarian is stuck down a well.

128.heading: Wells.
128.title: "Political Wishes Limited to $1.00 in Coins"
128.author: Thaves.
notes: Key words: Wishing wells, campaign funding.

129.heading: Wells.
129.title: "Shooting the Well!"
129.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Sid drops the go-devil and the nitro-glycerin explodes in the oil well.

130.heading: Wells.
130.title: "The Thing in the Well"
130.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leo Duranona
notes: "It was on that cold Maine night, a year ago, it happened. Most of what Nancy remembered was a vague nightmare. But at least it gave Nancy a friend. A friend who lived in the well!"

131.heading: Wells & Clark.
131.title: Arcana.
131.author: [No author]
notes: Began with no. 1 (Apr. 1994).
Fantasy/funny animal.

132.heading: Wells and Kaber's Lovely Lilly.
132.title: "A Punk Mother Goose : Wells and Kaber's Lovely Lilly"
132.author: [No author]
132.series: Fantasy in the Comics) p. 22-27 in Nemo, no. 27

133.heading: Wells Fargo.
133.title: Tales of Wells Fargo.
133.author: [No author]
notes: Published no. 876 (Feb. 1958) - no. 1215 (Oct./Dec. 1961), cf. Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide.
Numbering is in the one-shot series conventionally called Four Color, and proceeds as follows: no. 876, 968, 1023, 1075, 1113, 1167, 1215.
Genre: Western.

134.title: "Wells, Fargo and Company"
134.author: art by Severin and Elder
134.appears_in: 6 p. in Real Life Comics, no. 53 (July 1950).
notes: Cover title: "Stagecoach Empire, the Story of Wells, Fargo & Company."
About Henry Wells and Wm. G. Fargo.
